Cassiodorius (Insa. div. lit. 8) on the other hand says that Clement commented ‘ on the Canonical Epistles, that is to say, on the first Epistle of St. Peter, the first and second of St. John, and the Epistle of St. James.’ The notes on 1 Peter, Jude, 1 John, 2 John are still extant in a Latin translation, and some have doubted whether he really wrote on the other Catholic epistles, and would read Jude for Jamcs in Cassiodorius, see however Zahn, N. K. I. 322, Forsclcunymt iii. 153, Sanday in Smd. Bibl. iii. 248.
